hedline.hl1: The World; Shop Till You Drop Bombs

abstract.p: Congressional Research Service's report on international arms sales does not include many weapons that are essentially homemade tools; photos (M)

block.p: International arms sales have reached a four-year peak at nearly $30.3 billion, according to a recent report by the Congressional Research Service, with the largest exporters being the United States, Russia, Germany and China. But the report did not encompass another growth area: the gray market, where legally marketed weapons slip into unintended hands. Nor did it take note of the number of wars being fought with homemade tools. Here is a sample of some of the weapons included in the official survey, and others that weren't, as they may appear in an international arms catalog.
